meanings.definition: The act of stopping or the state of being stopped.
meanings.sent1: The stoppages in the traffic caused delays for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The sudden stoppages in the music surprised the audience.
meanings.sent3: The stoppages in the movie made the audience wonder what would happen next.
meanings.sent4: Her tears were like stoppages in the flow of the river, halting everything around her.
meanings.sent5: The stoppages in the assembly line brought production to a standstill.

meanings.definition: Something that stops or obstructs progress.
meanings.sent1: The fallen tree was a stoppage on the hiking trail.
meanings.sent2: The technical issues were a major stoppage in the project timeline.
meanings.sent3: The stoppage in the road made the drivers take a detour.
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure was a stoppage in his pursuit of his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The stoppage in communication led to misunderstandings among the team members.

meanings.definition: A deduction or withholding, as from wages.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected stoppage in his paycheck left him worried about his bills.
meanings.sent2: The union negotiated against any stoppages in employee salaries.
meanings.sent3: The stoppage in bonuses disappointed the employees.
meanings.sent4: The stoppage in overtime pay affected the workers' income.
meanings.sent5: The stoppage in benefits caused unrest among the staff.
